page.title: 03A TYPICAL JOURNEY TO SCHOOL
page.content: I get up at 7.00am,wash,dress and have my breakfast.After a short walk I catch the bus outside the church at Clodock at 8.15pm. The bus travels through the isolated rural settlements of Longtown,Craswell and Michaelchurch,a distance of 8 miles across the many hills and valleys of the foothills of the Black Mountains. Some settlements have no official name and are called by their local name such as "Bob's Shop".We leave the foothills by travelling down a hill called the'Slough' which leads us through Turnastone and Vowchurch.At Vowchurch we join the B4348 which takes us to school.The total journey is 15 miles and takes 50mins.The return journey is the same and I arrive home at about 4.30pm
